kubejs.ponder.tag.ars_nouveau.descriptio: Ponders for Ars Nouveau in this modpack
kubejs.ponder.tag.custom_mechanics.descr: All the custom crafting and interaction mechanics in this modpack
kubejs.ponder.arcane_portal_open.text_1: Right click a crying obsidian block with a source gem to open an Arcane Portal.
kubejs.ponder.arcane_portal_open.text_2: Once you open the portal, it requires a constant supply of liquefied source to stay open.
kubejs.ponder.arcane_portal_open.text_3: The Arcane Portal will consume a random liquefied source block  every so often.
kubejs.ponder.arcane_portal_open.text_4: If you don't replace the liquid source, the portal will rapidly become unstable and collapse.
kubejs.ponder.arcane_portal_usage.text_1: The portal will absorb wandering traders.
kubejs.ponder.arcane_portal_usage.text_2: The portal will also absorb correctly enchanted named pickaxes. The quest book will guide you on how to make the appropriate sacrifice.
kubejs.ponder.arcane_portal_usage.text_3: With the right sacrifices, the eldritch gods will be appeased and grant you a reward.
kubejs.ponder.arcane_portal_usage.text_4: Chapter 8 has its own mechanic that also involves sacrificing items to the Arcane Portal. You can read about it in the questbook.
kubejs.ponder.ars_nouveau_imbuement_cham: The Imbuement Chamber is one of the first magical crafting mechanics unlocked by Ars Nouveau.
Place Arcane Pedestals or Arcane Platforms around the Imbuement Chamber
Right click the pedestals with the necessary items.
Right click the Imbuement Chamber with the recipe input to begin the craft.
After some time, the input item will be transformed.
Note that imbuement does not consume the catalyst items on the pedestals.
Having a source jar nearby significantly increases the speed of the imbuement process.
Like any inventory, Imbuement Chambers can be inserted into and extracted from.
kubejs.ponder.ars_nouveau_relay.text_1: Source Relays move raw source from jar to jar.
kubejs.ponder.ars_nouveau_relay.text_10: Then bind all the source jars you want to distribute to and from.
kubejs.ponder.ars_nouveau_relay.text_11: You can also bind source relays to other source relays. This is very useful with the other types of source relays explained in the next scene
kubejs.ponder.ars_nouveau_relay.text_2: The Dominion Wand is used to bind source and destination blocks for source to move between.
kubejs.ponder.ars_nouveau_relay.text_3: Right click the source jar to take from.
kubejs.ponder.ars_nouveau_relay.text_4: Then right click the source relay to set the relay.
kubejs.ponder.ars_nouveau_relay.text_5: Right click the source relay again.
kubejs.ponder.ars_nouveau_relay.text_6: Then right click the destination source jar.
kubejs.ponder.ars_nouveau_relay.text_7: When binding blocks with the dominion wand, the source is always selected first, then the destination.
kubejs.ponder.ars_nouveau_relay.text_8: The regular source relay can only have one target and destination. To take and send from multiple jars, you need to upgrade it to a Source Relay: Splitter
kubejs.ponder.ars_nouveau_relay.text_9: Shift right click the source relay to clear the settings.
kubejs.ponder.ars_nouveay_relay_collecto: The Source Relay: Collector pulls source from all nearby source jars that are unbound.
Simply bind a destination jar and it will collect source into it.
The Source Relay: Depositor does the opposite, taking source from unbound source jars to deposit to bound source jars.
kubejs.ponder.beacon_usage.text_1: Beacons have some interesting additional behavior in this pack.
kubejs.ponder.beacon_usage.text_2: The beam of an active beacon can be redirected by corundum clusters, which also changes the color of the beam.
kubejs.ponder.beacon_usage.text_3: The final crystal cluster must still point towards the sky.
kubejs.ponder.beacon_usage.text_4: To perform an energized beacon craft, drop an item in the path of the beacon beam.
kubejs.ponder.beacon_usage.text_5: Then, right click the beacon with an energy carrier. See the recipes in JEI all for valid items.
kubejs.ponder.beehive_extraction.text_1: Beehives can be sheared to get their honeycombs when full. You can also do this with a deployer.
kubejs.ponder.beehive_extraction.text_2: You can also use a mechanical pump to extract liquid honey from the beehive.
kubejs.ponder.beehive_extraction.text_3: For a chance to get a rare saturated honeycomb, you will need to use a Sigil of Withdrawal on the beehive.
kubejs.ponder.beehive_extraction.text_4: The saturated honeycomb only has a chance to drop when the beehive full, using the Sigil of Withdrawal on the beehive will remove all the honey regardless of its fill level.
kubejs.ponder.beehive_extraction.text_5: Be careful when doing it! The Sigil of Withdrawal is so powerful that it will cause an explosion when it is used! Make sure there aren't any bees nearby.
kubejs.ponder.beehive_extraction.text_6: Each usage has a small chance to consume the Sigil of Withdrawal.
kubejs.ponder.beehive_extraction.text_7: You can use a comparator to measure the honey level of a beehive. A value of 5 means it's full.
kubejs.ponder.beehive_extraction.text_8: Don't block the front of the beehive though, or the bees won't be able to come out!
In addition to the recipes shown in JEI, amethyst shards can also be grown using budding amethyst as a catalyst.
In this pack, budding amethyst does not naturally cause attached buds to grow, and require crystal growth accelerator to be spouted on them.
For every 500mb of crystal growth accelerator spouted, a random amethyst bud attached to the budding amethyst will advance one growth stage.
kubejs.ponder.chromatic_bop_stick.text_1: Move a colored sheep on top of a Create drain.
kubejs.ponder.chromatic_bop_stick.text_2: Then smack them with the Chromatic Bop Stick.
kubejs.ponder.chromatic_bop_stick.text_3: This will fill the drain with Chromatic fluid, which you can pump out.
kubejs.ponder.chromatic_bop_stick.text_4: You can recolor the sheep to do this again.
kubejs.ponder.chromatic_bop_stick.text_5: The Chromatic Bop Stick can only do this once per color until it is recharged with a piece of Chromatic Compound.
kubejs.ponder.chromatic_bop_stick.text_6: Check the tooltip on the Chromatic Bop Stick to see which colors are left.
kubejs.ponder.dragons_breath_bottling.te: Dragon's breath can be automated using a dragon head.
Right click the dragon head with a Potion of Regeneration II.
It can be automatically bottled with a deployer clicking the block below it.
The deployer must have a block to right click on!
Enchanting is completely overhauled by Apotheosis in this pack.
Blocks placed around the enchanting table affect four attributes called Eterna, Quanta, Arcana, and Rectification. Refer to the Chronicle of Shadows for details about what they do.
Your vanilla enchanting setup gives you an Eterna level of 15, unlocking access to level 30 enchantments. The maximum enchanting power of any setup is twice the Eterna level.
Apotheosis adds advanced bookshelves that let you modify the enchanting attributes in almost any way you desire, leading to extremely powerful enchantments.
For example, here is a setup with 30 Eterna, unlocking level 60 enchantments.
Each tier of advanced bookshelves is gated by the previous tier.
This is an example setup for level 90 enchantments.
Experiment with different setups! There's no single best way to do it!
kubejs.ponder.ender_inhibitor.text_1: The Ender Inhibitor can inhibit nearby entities from teleporting.
kubejs.ponder.ender_inhibitor.text_2: It has an effective range of 9x9, centered on the block
kubejs.ponder.ender_inhibitor.text_3: Make sure the Ender Inhibitor has somewhere to put the fluid, or it will explode!
kubejs.ponder.fluid_sourcelink.text_1: Ars Nouveau requires source to be in its raw form inside source jars for its machines and blocks.
kubejs.ponder.fluid_sourcelink.text_2: The Fluid Sourcelink is the only way to get source into these jars from its liquid form.
kubejs.ponder.fluid_sourcelink.text_3: Pump liquid source into the fluid condenser and it will send it into nearby Source Jars.
kubejs.ponder.infested_stone_expulsion.t: Infested stone is full of pests!
You can expel the silverfish out of infested stone with a Sigil of Withdrawal.
If you expel all the silverfish, the infested stone will turn into end stone.
Each usage has a small chance to consume the Sigil of Withdrawal.
kubejs.ponder.moss_block_seeding.text_1: If you can't find a moss block, you can turn a stone block into one by right clicking it with biomass.
kubejs.ponder.moss_block_seeding.text_2: Right clicking a moss block with a fertilizer will cause it to spread to all nearby stone blocks.
kubejs.ponder.moss_block_seeding.text_3: Right clicking a moss block with a mushroom will seed it into a mushroom block.
kubejs.ponder.moss_block_seeding.text_4: This works with both red and brown mushrooms, and it will automatically spread.
kubejs.ponder.note_block_resonance_craft: Resonance crafting is a custom mechanic added by this modpack.
Place note blocks within 2 blocks of an Arcane Pedestal.
Place the input item on the pedestal
Play the right notes in the right order to perform the craft.
JEI will tell you what notes to play to perform each craft.
kubejs.ponder.remy_the_epicure.text_1: Right click the Remy Spawner on a block to spawn Remy The Epicure
kubejs.ponder.remy_the_epicure.text_2: Feed Remy some tasty food and he will drop amethyst buds.
kubejs.ponder.remy_the_epicure.text_3: Feeding can be automated with the deployer.
kubejs.ponder.remy_the_epicure.text_4: Feeding higher quality foods will result in more drops.
kubejs.ponder.remy_the_epicure.text_5: Remy will get tired of the same food over and over though.
kubejs.ponder.remy_the_epicure.text_6: There is a small cooldown every time you feed Remy.
kubejs.ponder.remy_the_epicure.text_7: Be careful not to feed Remy anything that'll give him an upset stomach.
kubejs.ponder.remy_the_epicure.text_8: You won't be able to feed Remy until the effect wears off.
kubejs.ponder.sculk_spreading.text_1: Sculk Catalysts can be used to generate sculk blocks
kubejs.ponder.sculk_spreading.text_2: An animal that dies near a Sculk Catalyst has a chance of causing a sculk bloom
kubejs.ponder.source_condenser.text_1: Souce Condensers perform the opposite function of fluid sourcelinks by converting raw source back into fluid.
kubejs.ponder.source_condenser.text_2: The Source Condenser will automatically pull from nearby source jars.
kubejs.ponder.source_condenser.text_3: It will also automatically push the liquefied source to a fluid tank placed underneath it.
